member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.Calculations.Comparisons.WithinMargin(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns true if the input floats a or b are within the margin of one another.
member.param: first value
second value
the margin by which the two values will be compared.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.Calculations.Operations.IntPower(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: returns a^b for two integers by using Exponentiation by Squaring
member.param: the integer base
the integer exponent
member.returns: a^b. 0 if too big to be stored in an integer.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.Calculations.Operations.RoundToSignificantDigits(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rounds the given value to the specified number of significant figures/digits.
member.param: The value to be rounded
the number of significant figures
member.returns: the rounded number

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.Calculations.VariableCalculations.GetIntMinimumBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the number of minimum bits required to represent this integer. Of course, all integers take the same space but a lower integer can be represented by less bits.
member.param: the integer
member.returns: the bits required to represent said integer. if negative, will return 32 as negative values require the flag. input the absolute value if you wish the minimum bits if the number was not negative to be returned.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.Converters.DateConverters.ConvertAmericanToSensible(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the american date system to the one understood by regular human beings.
member.param: a date of the format "month/day/..." in numerical form
member.returns: the same date of the format "day/month/..."

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.Converters.ToBinary.IntToBinary(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts an integer into its binary form.
member.param: the number to be converted.
member.returns: The LSB is represented by index 0. True is for 1 and false is for 0.

member.name: T:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool
member.summary: A monitored bool class that can be used such that whenever the bool value changes all the subscribers will be notified.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a monitored bool.
member.param: the initial value of the bool.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool.Finalize
member.summary: Upon destruction, nullifies all

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool.SetValue(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value of the monitored bool, notifying subscribed functions if the value is not the same.
member.param: the new bool value.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool.GetValue
member.summary: Gets the value of the monitored bool.
member.returns: the value of the monitored bool.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool.SubscribeValueChange(System.Action{QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool})
member.summary: Subscribes the given function to the bool such that the function will be called whenever the bool is changed.
member.param: the function to be called that shall accept this bool as its parameter.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool.UnSubscribeValueChange(System.Action{QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool})
member.summary: Unsubscribes the input function if it was subscribed in the first place.
member.param: the function to be potentially unsubscribed.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool.ToString
member.summary: returns the string value of the bool.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: performs bool.Equals(object obj) on the base bool value.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredBool.GetHashCode
member.summary: returns bool.GetHashCode(), where the bool is the base bool value.

member.summary: performs ulong.Equals(object obj) on the base ulong value.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredUlong.GetHashCode
member.summary: returns ulong.GetHashCode(), where the ulong is the base ulong value.

member.name: T:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredUshort
member.summary: A monitored ushort class that can be used such that whenever the ushort value changes all the subscribers will be notified.

member.summary: Creates a monitored ushort.
member.param: the initial value of the ushort.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredUshort.Finalize
member.summary: Upon destruction, nullifies all

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredUshort.SetValue(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Sets the value of the monitored ushort, notifying subscribed functions if the value is not the same.
member.param: the new ushort value.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredUshort.GetValue
member.summary: Gets the value of the monitored ushort.
member.returns: the value of the monitored ushort.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredUshort.SubscribeValueChange(System.Action{QuestryGameGeneral.MonitoredTypes.MonitoredUshort})
member.summary: Subscribes the given function to the ushort such that the function will be called whenever the ushort is changed.
member.param: the function to be called that shall accept this ushort as its parameter.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.PathFinding.DijkstraMap`1.AddNode(`0,System.Collections.Generic.List{QuestryGameGeneral.PathFinding.DijkstraMap{`0}.NodeLink})
member.summary: Adds a node and its connections to the map. O(n) where n= size of connectedTo. Also creates nodes for nodes that are already connected to. If a distance is different then changes distance.
member.param: Can be left as empty if you want simply the node to be added, and for example, will add the links later.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.PathFinding.DijkstraMap`1.AddNodes(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{QuestryGameGeneral.PathFinding.DijkstraMap{`0}.NodeLink}})
member.summary: A node Object and its list of connections have to be the same index in both lists input.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.PathFinding.DijkstraMap`1.RemoveNode(`0)
member.summary: Removes the node, along with the connections that it harbored.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.PathFinding.DijkstraMap`1.AddModifyNodeLink(`0,`0,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a link from a node to another or resets distance. If such a link already exists at the same distance or one of the nodes do not exist in the map the operation will fail and will return false. if the isModification variable is set to true without being sure that the two nodes exist and already have a connection between them, this will produce an error.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.PathFinding.DijkstraMap`1.RemoveNodeLink(`0,`0)
member.summary: removes the link between the two specified nodes. if the nodes do not exist returns false, otherwise returns true, even if the connection did not exist in the first place.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.PathFinding.DijkstraMap`1.FindPath(`0,`0)
member.summary: if one of the two input objects are not in the map or there is no valid path, will return a null path. Otherwise, will return a path that starts from the first destination to the end goal.

member.name: T:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor
member.summary: Executes a given function for every specified interval, unless the time given for one of the functions is not perfectly divided in which scenario the function will be once executed with the remainder. Especially useful for time-sensitive functions. The difference between the precise executor type is that this one will not be delayed in starting, meaning that the first execution will happen much faster than the ideal execution interval time, and that it is no considered erronous for the executions to happen faster than the ideal time (of course the proper time passed will be input)

member.name: T:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.Operation
member.summary: The type used for the Assigner and Disconnectors.

member.name: T:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.Execution
member.summary: The type used for Exeuction.
member.param: Time in milliseconds that has passed since last execution.

member.name: T:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.ErrorHandler
member.summary: The optional type called for when the kernel calls the thread of this object too late for the execution to be called within margin. This function will be called before the execution takes place.
member.param: The assigner function used
The disconnector function used
The executor function used.
The time left to be executed before all the intervals of execution were finished. This does not include the current interval.
The current interval of time before execution was stopped. This does not include the time elapsed after this function is called.
member.returns: Whether the thread should continue as normal to execute.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Threading.ThreadPriority,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Instantiates an Interval Executor.
member.param: The interval of time in milliseconds that is waited before the executions will be executed (ideally).
Whether the execution time of the execution is to be included in the interval waited between executions.
The priority at which the thread enumerating through the entries should be set.

True for when the timers should only be started when the whole object is started through StartExecution(), or false for immediately when the execution is added through AddEntry(). The associator, if defined, will also be called right before when the timer starts.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Threading.ThreadPriority,System.Boolean,System.Int32,QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.ErrorHandler)
member.summary: Instantiates an Interval Executor.
member.param: The interval of time in milliseconds the executions will be executed (ideally).
The margin of error as to how late the methods may be executed.
A custom function to be executed when the error is above the margin.
Whether the execution time of the execution is to be included in the interval waited between executions.
The priority at which the thread enumerating through the entries should be set.

True for when the timers should only be started when the whole object is started through StartExecution(), or false for immediately when the execution is added through AddEntry(). The associator, if defined, will also be called right before when the timer starts.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.StartExecution
member.summary: Starts the execution of the entries.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.StopExecution(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops the execution of the entries. If in the middle of an execution, waits for it to end.
member.param: UNSAFE. Ends the execution thread(s) immediately. This might corrupt data or lead to unpredictable behaviour. Use at your own risk.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.AddEntry(QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.Execution,System.Int64)
member.summary: Adds an execution to be run in specified intervals.
member.param: The execution. Must take integer value that represents the amount of time that has passed.
The amount of total time it is to be executed before it is released. negative if you wish it to never be released.
member.returns: The unique ID representing this execution. Store it if you would like to access the execution later on.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.AddEntry(QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.Execution,QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.Operation,System.Int64)
member.summary: Adds an execution to be run in specified intervals.
member.param: The execution. Must take integer value that represents the amount of time that has passed.
The disassociator. Executed once when the execution's last execution is executed.
The amount of total time it is to be executed before it is released. negative if you wish it to never be released. This will override any disassociator input.
member.returns: The unique ID representing this execution. Store it if you would like to access the execution later on.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.AddEntry(QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.Operation,QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.Execution,QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.Operation,System.Int64)
member.summary: Adds an execution to be run in specified intervals.
member.param: The associator. Run in accordance with the ResetQueued Property set when this object was constructed. The associators of a single object should not differ too much in workload, as otherwise there might be some large deviations in the start times of the different executions.
The execution. Must take integer value that represents the amount of time that has passed.
The disassociator. Executed once when the execution's last execution is executed.
The amount of total time it is to be executed before it is released. negative if you wish it to never be released. This will override any disassociator input.
member.returns: The unique ID representing this execution. Store it if you would like to access the execution later on.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.RemoveEntry(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes an execution entry based on its ID. If an entry is about to be run the entry may not be removed first.
member.param: ID of execution to be removed.
Whether the disassociator function should be called. f none assigned at the start, this is meaningless.
member.returns: Whether the entry was existant or not.

member.name: M:QuestryGameGeneral.TimedExecutors.ImpreciseIntervalExecutor.GetExecutionTotalTimeLeft(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the total milliseconds of time the specified execution has before it is removed. Meaningless for indefinite executions, as these get immediately revived after they "run out" of time.
member.param: The Unique ID that identifies this execution.
member.returns: The total milliseconds of time the specified execution has before it is removed. returns long.MinValue if wrong ID is supplied
